questions.question: How do I put this tool to use today, thinking about energy action in poor communities?
What do you think of the efforts of Tesla and Elon Musk on pushing forward the electric car revolution?
What are the policies that we can take and how effective are they gonna be?
Let me ask the question of, what do you find most beautiful and fascinating about our planet Earth?
What is the mechanism by which the human species becomes extinct because of climate change?
Can I take a quick aside and ask about terminology of climate change and global warming?
You just simply say, what are all the costs on one side and what are all the benefits?
So can we just list some of the things, if you got $75 billion, how do you spend them?
The, that end, how do you, how do you innovate at the household level, the village level?
And what, maybe is that a case study of how alarmism can turn into a productive, constructive policy?
So that's a long way of asking the question of how is politics mixed into all of this?
We could find lots of things we disagree on, but that takes it back to the win-lose model, right?
When you look at those curves, is there anything in that curve that says, oh, climate treaty, 1992?
Well, you know, biologically, evolution has demanded that life is about finding sources of energy and perpetuating yourself, right?
